definition: nearing death/on the point of demise/approaching extinction

sentences.english: Yeats describes mankind's fleshly predicament as a soul fastened to a dying animal.
sentences.chinese: 描繪了當靈魂依附於瀕死的動物時人類肉體的窘境。

sentences.english: What was your first interview like with someone who had reported an out-of-body experience?
sentences.chinese: 你初次與有“瀕死體驗“的人訪談是怎樣的呢？

sentences.english: A study last year, by the way, found that near-death experiences are link to oxygen deprivation.
sentences.chinese: 去年的一項研究發現此項瀕死體驗是與缺氧有關。

sentences.english: Seven years later, he is still consumed with his own near-death experience.
sentences.chinese: 甚至七年後的今天，他仍然爲自己的瀕死體驗而着迷。

sentences.english: The most common cause of near-death experience in my research group is fainting.
sentences.chinese: 在我的研究小組中，瀕死體驗的最常見原因是暈倒。

sentences.english: Imagine a body towards the end of life,on life support machinery.
sentences.chinese: 想象一下身體瀕死，靠着維持生命的機械存活。

sentences.english: Some 15 million Americans have had near death experiences.
sentences.chinese: 大約一千五百萬美國人有瀕死的經歷。

sentences.english: Medically speaking, what is a near-death experience?
sentences.chinese: 醫學上來說，什麼是瀕死體驗呢？

definition: to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
vertigo/dizziness/fainting/feeling of swaying, head spinning, lack of balance or floating (e.g. from a stroke)/Taiwan pr. [xuan4 yun1]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
